intro: Pyrethrum transiliense, commonly known as the Transilvanian pyrethrum, is a flowering plant native to the Carpathian region of Central Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with white petals and yellow centers. The plant produces fine, hair-like structures called trichomes, which contain pyrethrins—natural insecticides. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in open woodland or grassy areas. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in pest control, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
